summary: Interactive, chat-led corporate gifting website for Pegasus Gifting with premium B2B styling and a guided 2–3 step qualification flow that hands off to WhatsApp.
architectural_notes: Conversational, card-based UI with minimal text and smooth transitions; avoid traditional static-site navigation.
Do not display pricing, delivery promises, or vendor details anywhere in the experience.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Red Pegasus logo mark on transparent background (pegasus-logo-red.dim_512x512.png)
- Red Pegasus favicon icon on transparent background (pegasus-favicon-red.dim_64x64.png)

existing_features.title: Update the site’s visual design to a premium B2B look with a light background, bold red primary accents, and clean white contrast accents; ensure all primary CTAs, borders/rings, and chat UI highlights use the red primary color consistently.
Add a header that clearly displays the brand name “PEGASUS GIFTING” alongside a red Pegasus logo, and keep the overall header styling premium and professional for B2B clients.
Make the homepage behave as a guided, chat-led experience (not a traditional long static page) that asks 2–3 click-based questions to qualify intent before offering a WhatsApp handoff.

Implement a minimal branching flow: first ask what the user is looking for (Bulk corporate gifting vs Single/few gifts vs Exploration/Not sure), then ask either quantity range (for bulk) or purpose/occasion (for single/few), then show a WhatsApp handoff only after the second question is answered.

Add an “Unsure / Exploration” path that shows a short “How It Works” explanation inside the guided conversation and offers an option to view/download the Master Catalogue PDF before suggesting WhatsApp.

Ensure curated gift categories are highlighted as selectable cards within the guided flow (and/or as an optional exploration step) to support both bulk and single orders without showing pricing, delivery promises, or vendor details.

Update WhatsApp handoff UX and copy so it feels natural and intentional: label it as “Speak to our team” (not a salesy push), include clear but non-pushy CTAs, and prefill the WhatsApp message with the user’s selected path answers (intent + quantity/purpose + category if chosen).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create Pegasus Gifting branded website UI (bold red theme on light background, white accents, red Pegasus logo) with header displaying 'PEGASUS GIFTING' in a premium B2B style.
Implement guided, chat-led interaction (card-based, smooth transitions) with 2–3 click-based questions to qualify intent (bulk corporate gifting vs single/few gifts vs exploration).
Add smart branching flow: ask intent first, then ask quantity range or purpose as appropriate, and only then offer WhatsApp handoff once interest is gauged.
Provide an 'Unsure' path with a short 'How It Works' explanation and option to view/download a Master Catalogue PDF before suggesting WhatsApp.
Support both bulk and single orders and highlight curated gift categories with clear but non-pushy CTAs.
Implement WhatsApp handoff UX positioned as 'Speak to our team' (natural, intentional, never forced).
